page.title: 01The Township of Meltham
page.content: {Meltham}with a population of about 7000 lies 5 miles to the east of {Huddersfield}in a river basin between the River Holme and Colne on the eastern slopes of the{Pennines.}Angles are thought to have given it its name after a smelting place when they settled there about 650 A.D. The{textile industry}has existed in the area for a long time,weaving taking place in the cottages before mills were built.Peasant farmers needed to supplement their income,due to the climate and poverty of the soil.{Peat Moorland}and{rough pasture of the higher land used for sheep surround the lower better managed agricultural land, now mainly used for {dairy cattle.}Looking down on the town tall chimneys can be seen towering over matchbox stone houses,all cramped together.
